critique: This document pertains to the National Industrial Recovery Act, which was a New Deal program. This suggests a liberal ideological tilt due to government intervention in the economy. The document doesn't directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. However, the approval of a code of fair competition implies government intervention in the economy. Therefore, the economic regulation score should be positive. Given that this is an executive action, it could be seen as expanding executive power, but the document states it is pursuant to and in full compliance with the provisions of title I of the National Industrial Recovery Act, so it is not expanding executive power.
